body: I think a reason why nowadays you don't hear trigger warnings much and instead hear _content_ warnings  is precisely so that the concept of triggers is present, but not made very evident. This way, someone who is susceptible to the topics listed will be alerted to it before they buy, and the people against it don't see a list that they'll read essentially as "I can't read anything about these topics because I'm weak and frail" and instead (hopefully) will see it as an ESRB label.
